disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Saturday 5 March to end of Monday 7 March GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: A weekend of cloud and rain is forecast, with a northerly wind bringing a feed of relatively 'clean' air into London, initially from the Atlantic and then the North Sea.  <br/><br/>By Monday afternoon winds become more easterly as an area of high pressure moves over the UK, however as this air flow is expected to be at high altitude, little  pollution import is expected.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Tuesday 8 March to end of Wednesday 9 March GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Tuesday will be mainly dry with plenty of sunshine. Possible rain in the evening. Cloud cover and some sunny spells are forecast for Wednesday. <br/>Back trajectories show the air arriving in the UK from the east, however as this air flow is travelling at high altitude, little  pollution import is expected.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>
